SEARCH
Package com.example.haboob

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.haboob.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Event extends Object implements Serializable
Event models a single event and encapsulates both its metadata (title, dates, organizer, tags, poster/QR) and dynamic participant lists (invited, waiting, enrolled, cancelled).

The class also includes helper methods for mutating participant lists in Firestore, using the eventID field to locate the backing document.

Notes:

  • For local unit tests, use Event(boolean) with true to avoid initializing Firebase.
  • eventID is generated by the model (UUID) and stored as a field; it is not the Firestore doc ID.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      Default constructor used by Firestore deserialization. Initializes Firebase (db) and participant lists.

    • Event

      public Event(boolean inMemoryOnly)
      Test-friendly constructor. When inMemoryOnly is true, Firebase is not initialized.
      Parameters:
      inMemoryOnly - whether to skip Firebase initialization

    • Event

      public Event(String organizer, Date registrationStartDate, Date registrationEndDate, String eventTitle, String eventDescription, boolean geoLocationRequired, int lotterySampleSize, int optionalWaitingListSize, Poster poster, ArrayList<String> tags)
      Full constructor that generates a UUID-based eventID and initializes all key fields.
      Parameters:
      organizer - organizer user ID
      registrationStartDate - registration window start
      registrationEndDate - registration window end
      eventTitle - title of the event
      eventDescription - description/details
      geoLocationRequired - whether geolocation is required
      lotterySampleSize - size of lottery sample (invites)
      optionalWaitingListSize - optional waiting list size; use -1 if unlimited/not set
      poster - event poster object
      tags - tag list for filtering/search

    • Event

      public Event(String organizer, Date registrationStartDate, Date registrationEndDate, String eventTitle, String eventDescription, boolean geoLocationRequired, int lotterySampleSize, int optionalWaitingListSize, ArrayList<String> tags)

    • Event

      public Event(String organizerId, Date date, Date date1, String s, String s1, boolean b, int i, Object o, Object o1, List<String> tags)
      Minimal constructor used by tests that expect a specific signature. (Fields are not initialized; provided only to satisfy test scaffolding.)

    • Event

      public Event(String organizer, Date registrationStartDate, Date registrationEndDate, String eventTitle, String eventDescription, boolean geoLocationRequired, int lotterySampleSize, QRCode qrCode, Poster poster, ArrayList<String> tags, ArrayList<String> entrant_ids_for_lottery)
      Alternate constructor where tags are a simple list and waiting list size is defaulted to -1.
      Parameters:
      organizer - organizer user ID
      registrationStartDate - start date
      registrationEndDate - end date
      eventTitle - title
      eventDescription - description
      geoLocationRequired - whether geolocation is required
      lotterySampleSize - lottery sample size
      qrCode - QR code object
      poster - poster object
      tags - tag list
      entrant_ids_for_lottery - IDs of entrants included in lottery

    • addEntrantToWaitingEntrants

      public void addEntrantToWaitingEntrants(String userID)

      Parameters:
      userID - user ID to add

    • moveEntrantFromInvitedToEnrolled

      public void moveEntrantFromInvitedToEnrolled(String userID)
      Moves a user from invitedEntrants to enrolledEntrants when they accept their invitation. Does NOT trigger vacancy filling from the waiting list (unlike removeEntrantFromInvitedEntrants). Also removes the user from waitingEntrants if present.
      Parameters:
      userID - user ID to move

    • removeEntrantFromCancelledEntrants

      public void removeEntrantFromCancelledEntrants(String userID)
      Adds a user ID to cancelledEntrants in Firestore (arrayUnion) and locally. (Method name suggests removal; current implementation adds. Keep as-is if intentional.)
      Parameters:
      userID - user ID to process

    • removeEntrantLocation
